page.title: 12Farms part 2
page.content: Carldane Court was inherited by Hugh Crammoth, Crallon's son, and he held it until 1953. He too was an architect and he developed the house even more, building the new wing, so extending it to almost three times its original size.When he retired he sold the house to Patrick Dollan who bought it with about 53 acres. Mr. Dollan altered the house quite considerably. He extended the garden and bought land from the Lordship Estate. The farm now extends to 435 acres, 401 acres of which are under arable cropping and the rest is woodland. In 1977 a Dutchman Mr.Van Englan bought the house and farm.He has a farm manager, Mr.Peter Glogner, who manages the estate for him as he only uses the house as a holiday home and so is out of the country for a lot of the time.
